item.title: What is String in Java
item.description:
String In Java

In lemon language, we can identify String as a Collection Of Characters. But in java String identify as an object. We can declare String as an array In java as well as simple way as we write a String, But both the way String object collect that value as same.

Those two methods are below to declare a String.

1. Declare String using array:

    char c [] = {'d','a','r','s','h'}
    String s = new String(c);

2. Declare as String Object.

   String d = "darsh";

Note: The above two methods work similarly.

String Methods In Java

The string has numerous method which we can use for simplifying logic. few of the method names and descriptions we can understand via the below matrix.

Method Name Description Return Value
isEmpty() verify for emptry string boolean
length() return length of string int
toLowerCase() return string in lowercase String
toUpperCase() return string in uppercase String
charAt(int index) return char value of praticular index char

How many ways we can create a String object?

There is two way we can create an object of String as below :

1. Using String literal

2. Using new keyword

1. Using String literal

The string has double quotes that identify as literal.

   String d = "darsh khatri";

Whenever you create a String object using String literal, so it will be found in JVM String pool. If the value of String already exists and it returns a reference of that String pool instance. Suppose if there has not a similar value of String in the String pool then, it will create a new object in JVM.

Illustration:

   String d = "Peter Parker";
   String k = "Peter Parker";

We have two objects as per the above pis of code. the first String value of the handler is ’d' and the second is ‘k’ . Both contain the same value and only one instance is created in JVM String pool, and the other carriers as a reference of the first one.

1. Create String using new keyword

   String s = new String("Darsh");

In the above case, JVM creates a new object of String in heap memory, and the String literal Darsh will be in the String pool. The variable ’s' is a handle or reference variable of that object.

String Example in Java

    public class Employee{
        public static void main(String args[]){
            String e1 = "Peter Parker";
            char c [] = {'j','o','h','n'};
            String e2 = new String(c);
            String e3 = new String("kate");
            System.out.println(e1);  
            System.out.println(e2);  
            System.out.println(e3);
        }   
    }

Output is :

   Peter Parker
   john
   kate

Conclusion Points:

  • Collection of characters called String.
  • String is Object.
  • We can create String two-way. 1) String literal and 2) Using new keyword. .
  • If Literal String have a similar value so, a new reference is not created in JVM string pool. It uses the reference of duplicate value.
  • String has various methods so, we can use that for different types of operation.

item.title: Best 2 Way to Loss Your Weight Tips
item.description:
There is numerous way to loss bodyweight but out of all of those, I will let you know about the most effective 2 methods of losing weight.

Weight is the most important factor for our body as well as our health, mind. we can face lots of issues due to overweight, but here I suggest you to some healthy tips to reduce your weight and maintain your balance.

1. Eath Healthy Food

Healthy food is an extremely key point in our body and one of the very known quotes that I remember at this point is “You Are What You Eat”. We need to eat healthy food like vegetables, fruits as well as dried fruits such as almond, walnut, apricot, raisins, walnuts, etc.

Apart from the above, we can consume seeds like Chia seeds. We can inject that in several ways like: prepare ice cream or milk using seeds.

How can we forget “Fruits” while we are discussing weight loss and maintain the body?

Fruits are a natural source of gaining vitamins and nutrition for our body, so we can get plenty of energy to achieve our daily goals. We must eat fruits that contain ample water like watermelon, strawberries, peaches, orange, etc.

Consumption of fruits is also effective for our skin plus the intestine and it also helps for increasing immunity.

Remember that we need to eat so many colors at the time of lunch and breakfast, hence we can feel energetic in our fields.

2. Natural Exercise(WorkOut)

2.1 Walking

There is numerous exercise which you can do for reduce weight and belly fat. The primary exercise is “Walk”. Every human needs to walk at least 30min per day, which helps to reduce weight and maintain the body, increased cardiovascular, decreased risk of heart stroke, or heart-related disease. “Walking” helps to make a born stronger and burn calories. Apart from that below is more advantages of “30 minutes Walking” every day.

Advantage of 30 minutes Walk.

  • Increase immunity
  • Improve mental health
  • Creative Thinking
  • It can help to control or lower blood sugar

2.2 Yoga

Indian assistant foremost root for “exercise” is “Yoga” and now a day it is most popular to maintain a body and reduce weight. There are varipus pose in yoga that helps to reduce weight like : “Bhujangasana, Kumbhakasana, Naukasana, Ustrasana, Dhanurasana”.

Bhujangasana (Cobra pose)

Kumbhakasana(The plank)

Naukasana(Boat pose)

Ustrasana(Camel Pose)

Dhanurasana(Bow pose)

“Surya Namaskar” is also best for maintaining the body, energy as well as fat loss. It’s a good cardio exercise and Its stances help in extending your stomach muscles making you shed pounds around the midsection so, approximately 10 minutes of “Surya Namaskar” burning “139 calories”. It is also helpful to bring down blood sugar levels.

Prefer timing for “Surya Namaskar” is either in early(sunrise time) morning or late evening(sunset)

You can follow the below way to do “Surya Namaskar”.

To put it in nutshell, the above two methods assist you to help improve your immune system if you follow them in daily routine life also it helps to reduce weight.

Stay Healthy and Stay Fit.
